recipes: Dark days. I must be careful not to let doubts creep in. [Dread may provoke full-fledged Despair.]
Despair is the wolf that devours thought. [You can defeat Despair by feeding it Contentment; otherwise, it will destroy you when it reaches 3 Dread.]
Despair pads close at my heels. The world is leached of light. [You can defeat Despair by feeding it Contentment; otherwise, it will destroy you when it reaches 3 Dread.]
This exists specifically for the burn image at 2 Dread.
Memories of better times keep the wolf from the door. [Each Contentment destroys one Dread.]
This is almost the end - [Find Contentment now, or it's over.]
Where will they find me? I am not here.
Consider (1) allowing the threshold to grab Dread too. (2) allowing the active step to have a low-risk possibility of increasing Dread (3) providing a reward when Despair is defeated
The wolf Despair prowls elsewhere. [No Dread empowers this Despair. It's over, for now.]
The sun flickers like a shadow. Dreams ripple behind the surface of mirrors. I must be careful not to drift from the waking world. [Fascination may provoke Visions]

Paintings whisper. Windows wink. I know these things are not true, but how can I be certain? [You can defeat Visions with Dread or a Fleeting Memory; otherwise, you will lose yourself completely at Fascination 3.]
The world is dangerously bright. [You can defeat Visions with Dread or a Fleeting Memory; otherwise, you will lose yourself completely at Fascination 3.]
This exists specifically for the burn image at 2 Fascination.
What is the light that brims the surface of everything? The Glory is coming, but I cannot be here to see it - [If you don't find Dread or a Fleeting Memory now, it's over.]
Where will they find me? I am not here.
Shadows are shelter from light. Despair is ballast. Even misery has its uses. [Each Dread quells one Fascination.]
The solidity of the everyday banishes phantoms. I tether myself to the everyday. [Each Fleeting Memory quells one Fascination.]
Mirrors are calm. The sun is steady. The Glory recedes. I am sane, if that means anything. [No Fascination drives your Visions. It's over, for now.]
The Dry Soul Curse has not yet taken effect.
The Dry Soul Curse settles softly, like a withered hand on the shoulder.
My skull creaks. The light greys.
The Fifth Eye Curse has not yet taken effect.
The Third Eye is a myth, or the pineal gland. The Fourth Eye is a Mark in certain processes of ascension. The Fifth Eye now opens before me.
I cannot stop seeing. If I look long enough, I will not wish to.
The Creeping Breath curse has not yet come due.
The Creeping Breath Curse begins with a cough - a cough that loiters in one's throat like a debt-collector.
Each breath we take in this life is weaker than the last, until we come to the final breath of all. The process is so slow as to be imperceptible... until one is touched by the Creeping Breath Curse.
I glimpse subtle movement in the world - like the floaters which sometimes move through the eye, but slyer. Sometimes, too, I hear them.

There are Worms in the city. One does not see Worms, but neither does one forget them. They will search until they find someone they can enter through the spaces in the skin, and then do what Worms will.
When Worms take flesh, there is nothing to be done except destroy what remains - burn and sift with the utmost care.
